tools.description: Apply Text Update AND Commit.
tools.name: apply_text_update_and_commit

tools.description: Allow or block tools marked write_action=True for this server.
tools.name: authorize_write_actions

tools.description: Build a normalized JSON summary for a pull request description.
tools.name: build_pr_summary

tools.description: Fetch one or more files and persist them in the server-side cache so assistants can recall them without repeating GitHub reads. Use refresh=true to bypass existing cache entries.
tools.name: cache_files

tools.name: close_pull_request

tools.name: comment_on_issue

tools.name: comment_on_pull_request

tools.name: commit_workspace_files

tools.description: Create Branch.
tools.name: create_branch

tools.description: Create File.
tools.name: create_file

tools.description: Create a GitHub issue in the given repository.
tools.name: create_issue

tools.description: Open a pull request from ``head`` into ``base``.
tools.name: create_pull_request

tools.description: Create Repository.
tools.name: create_repository

tools.description: Delete a file from a GitHub repository using the Contents API. Use ensure_branch if you want to delete on a dedicated branch.
tools.name: delete_file

tools.description: Return metadata and optional schema for one or more tools. Prefer this over manually scanning list_all_actions in long sessions.
tools.name: describe_tool

tools.description: Download user-provided content (sandbox/local/http) with base64 encoding.
tools.name: download_user_content

tools.description: Ensure Branch.
tools.name: ensure_branch

tools.name: ensure_workspace_clone

tools.name: fetch_files

tools.name: fetch_issue

tools.name: fetch_issue_comments

tools.name: fetch_pr_comments

tools.description: Fetch URL.
tools.name: fetch_url

tools.description: GET Branch Summary.
tools.name: get_branch_summary

tools.description: Return cached file payloads for a repository/ref without re-fetching from GitHub. Entries persist for the lifetime of the server process until evicted by size or entry caps.
tools.name: get_cached_files

tools.description: GET Commit Combined Status.
tools.name: get_commit_combined_status

tools.description: Fetch a single file from GitHub and decode base64 to UTF-8 text.
tools.name: get_file_contents

tools.description: Return a citation-friendly slice of a file.

tools.description: Render a compact, line-numbered view of a file to simplify manual edits.
tools.name: get_file_with_line_numbers

tools.description: GET Issue Comment Reactions.
tools.name: get_issue_comment_reactions

tools.description: Return a high-level overview of an issue, including related branches, pull requests, and checklist items, so assistants can decide what to do next.
tools.name: get_issue_overview

tools.description: Fetch raw logs for a GitHub Actions job without truncation.
tools.name: get_job_logs

tools.description: GET Latest Branch Status.
tools.name: get_latest_branch_status

tools.description: GET PR Info.
tools.name: get_pr_info

tools.description: Return a compact overview of a pull request, including files and CI status.
tools.name: get_pr_overview

tools.description: Fetch reactions for a GitHub pull request.
tools.name: get_pr_reactions

tools.description: Fetch reactions for a pull request review comment.
tools.name: get_pr_review_comment_reactions

tools.description: GET Rate Limit.
tools.name: get_rate_limit

tools.description: List recent server-side errors captured in memory.
tools.name: get_recent_server_errors

tools.description: Return recent server-side logs captured in memory (useful when provider logs are unavailable).
tools.name: get_recent_server_logs

tools.description: List recent tool invocation events captured in memory.
tools.name: get_recent_tool_events

tools.description: Fetch basic Render service metrics (defaults to RENDER_SERVICE_ID when resourceId is omitted; requires RENDER_API_KEY).
tools.name: get_render_metrics

tools.description: Return a compact, multi-signal dashboard for a repository.
tools.name: get_repo_dashboard

tools.description: GET Repo Defaults.
tools.name: get_repo_defaults

tools.description: Look up repository metadata (topics, default branch, permissions).
tools.name: get_repository

tools.description: GET Server Config.
tools.name: get_server_config

tools.description: GET User Login.
tools.name: get_user_login

tools.description: Retrieve a specific workflow run including timing and conclusion.
tools.name: get_workflow_run

tools.description: Summarize a GitHub Actions workflow run for CI triage.
tools.name: get_workflow_run_overview

tools.description: Summarize modified, added, deleted, renamed, and untracked files in the workspace.
tools.name: get_workspace_changes_summary

tools.description: Read a file from the persistent workspace clone (no shell).
tools.name: get_workspace_file_contents

tools.description: Graphql Query.
tools.name: graphql_query

tools.name: list_pull_requests

tools.description: List recent failed or cancelled GitHub Actions workflow runs.
tools.name: list_recent_failures

tools.description: List Recent Issues.
tools.name: list_recent_issues

tools.name: list_render_logs

tools.description: List Repositories.
tools.name: list_repositories

tools.name: list_repositories_by_installation

tools.description: List Repository Issues.
tools.name: list_repository_issues

tools.description: List Repository Tree.
tools.name: list_repository_tree

tools.description: List available MCP tools with basic read/write metadata. Use describe_tool (or list_all_actions with include_parameters=true) when you need full schemas.
tools.name: list_tools

tools.description: List jobs within a workflow run, useful for troubleshooting failures.
tools.name: list_workflow_run_jobs

tools.description: List recent GitHub Actions workflow runs with optional filters.
tools.name: list_workflow_runs

tools.description: List files in the workspace clone (bounded, no shell).
tools.name: list_workspace_files

tools.description: Describe write-capable tools exposed by this server.
tools.name: list_write_tools

tools.description: Merge Pull Request.
tools.name: merge_pull_request

tools.description: Move File.
tools.name: move_file

tools.description: Return a citation-friendly slice of a file with line numbers and content entries.
tools.name: open_file_context

tools.description: Return an issue plus related branches and pull requests.
tools.name: open_issue_context

tools.description: Open a pull request for an existing branch into a base branch.
tools.name: open_pr_for_existing_branch

tools.description: Ping the MCP server extensions surface.
tools.name: ping_extensions

tools.description: PR Smoke Test.
tools.name: pr_smoke_test

tools.description: Return recent pull requests associated with a branch, grouped by state.
tools.name: recent_prs_for_branch

tools.description: Render-focused shell entry point for interacting with GitHub workspaces.
tools.name: render_shell

tools.description: Resolve Handle.
tools.name: resolve_handle

tools.description: Deprecated alias for terminal_command.
tools.name: run_command

tools.description: Run the lint or static-analysis command in the workspace.
tools.name: run_lint_suite

tools.description: Run the standard quality/test suite for a repo/ref.
tools.name: run_quality_suite

tools.description: Run the project's test command in the persistent workspace and summarize the result.
tools.name: run_tests

tools.description: Search.
tools.name: search

tools.description: Search text files in the workspace clone (bounded, no shell).
tools.name: search_workspace

tools.description: Replace a workspace file's contents by writing the full file text.
tools.name: set_workspace_file_contents

tools.description: Run a shell command inside the repo workspace and return its result.
tools.name: terminal_command

tools.description: Trigger a workflow and block until it completes or hits timeout.
tools.name: trigger_and_wait_for_workflow

tools.description: Trigger a workflow dispatch event on the given ref.
tools.name: trigger_workflow_dispatch

tools.description: Update a single file in a GitHub repository from the persistent workspace checkout. Use terminal_command to edit the workspace file first, then call this tool to sync it back to the branch.
tools.name: update_file_from_workspace

tools.description: Commit multiple files, verify each, then open a PR in one call.
tools.name: update_files_and_open_pr

tools.description: Update fields on an existing GitHub issue.
tools.name: update_issue

tools.description: Check GitHub-related environment settings and report problems.
tools.name: validate_environment

tools.description: Validate a JSON string and return a normalized form.
tools.name: validate_json_string

tools.description: Validate candidate payload(s) against tool input schemas without running them.
tools.name: validate_tool_args

tools.description: Poll a workflow run until completion or timeout.
tools.name: wait_for_workflow_run

tools.description: Create a branch using the workspace (git), optionally pushing to origin.
tools.name: workspace_create_branch

tools.description: Delete a non-default branch using the workspace clone.
tools.name: workspace_delete_branch

tools.description: Detect a mangled workspace branch and recover to a fresh branch.
tools.name: workspace_self_heal_branch

notes.purpose: Authoritative, machine-readable input schemas for every MCP tool/action exposed by this server, with tightened typing to avoid '{}' properties.
